role.descr: entity putting something around something else

example.name: gird-v: canonical usage
example.text: `` How can I face the world if I ca n't gird my loins with comic book characters ? '' asked John .

roleset.note: GIRD-V NOTES: Also a Calvin & Hobbes reference. (from gird.01-v)

roleset.name: prepare, get ready for

example.name: gird-v: unstated arg1
example.text: As rescuers pressed their efforts after finding a survivor in a collapsed freeway , the San Francisco Bay area girded for hundreds of thousands of commuters seeking to avoid routes ravaged by last Tuesday 's tremor .

roleset.note: GIRD-V NOTES: The arg1 above would properly be "itself". This sense is actually anextension of the other; literally 'gird' means 'to put on a belt.'Originally the belt carried one's weapons; thus to 'gird for battle'used a purpose phrase, which gradually became more prominent until thenew sense took over. (from gird.02-v)
